instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115-B, No Chime, No Display, Fan Spins Faster and Faster
threads.message: A1278 2012 820-3115-B motherboard reported liquid damage.  Board looks visibly OK, no corrosion that I see.   I get a green light on the charger, and the fan spins normally for 10-20 seconds, then starts spinning faster.  No chime, and no display.  Bad SMC perhaps?

threads.message: I asked if voltage is present, not diode mode.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115-B, No Chime, No Display, Fan Spins Faster and Faster
threads.message: Sorry duke, terminology brainfart, I'm getting a solid 1.12V on ppvcore_s0_cpu

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115-B, No Chime, No Display, Fan Spins Faster and Faster
threads.message: Could be anything, really need the history. I doubt this "just" happened.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115-B, No Chime, No Display, Fan Spins Faster and Faster
threads.message: I ran this one through another ultrasonic cleaner.  It still exhibited the same symptoms, get a green light, and the fan begins spinning faster after 20-30 seconds.  I installed it back into the laptop, and miraculously turns on and functions normally, with fan spinning at normal speed.  You can mark this one as solved I suppose, though not sure what fixed it.  Thank you.
